data.title: The Power (2021 Indian film)
authors: Contributors to JH Movie Collection Wiki
data.meta_description: The Power is a 2021 Indian Hindi-language action thriller film written and directed by Mahesh Manjrekar.[1] It stars Vidyut Jammwal, Shruti Haasan, Zakir Hussain, Prateik Babbar, Sachin Khedekar and Jisshu Sengupta.[2] The film was released on the online streaming service Zee Plex on 14 January...
data.text:
The Power is a 2021 Indian Hindi-language action thriller film written and directed by Mahesh Manjrekar.[1] It stars Vidyut Jammwal, Shruti Haasan, Zakir Hussain, Prateik Babbar, Sachin Khedekar and Jisshu Sengupta.[2] The film was released on the online streaming service Zee Plex on 14 January 2021.[3][4][5][6]

The film received mixed reviews, who appreciated action sequences performed byJammwal , and editing, but criticized for pace, screenplay, and Manjrekar's direction.it is copy of Firoz khan's dharmatma

Cast[]

Vidyut Jammwal as Devidas Thakur

Shruti Haasan as Parveen / Pari

Zakir Hussain as Anwar

Sachin Khedekar as Vishambhar Rana

Sonal Chauhan as Chandini

Jisshu Sengupta as Ramdas Thakur

Mahesh Manjrekar as Kaalidas Haridas Thakur

Medha Manjrekar as Uma Kaalidas Thakur

Prateik Babbar as Ranjeet

Mrunmayee Deshpande as Ratna Thakur

Sudhanshu Pandey as Rocky

Yuvika Chaudhary as Shaila Thakur

Salil Ankola as Robert

Sameer Dharmadhikari as Francis Dcosta

Chetan Hansraj as Fakira

Vidyadhar Joshi as Bhau

Savita Malpekar as Thakur's Maid

Ganesh Yadav as Potya

Reception[]

Anna M. M. Vetticad said that the film is "engaging to begin with, but as it rolls along it becomes clear that it falls in the ‘if you’ve seen one, you’ve seen ’em all’ category of underworld dramas."[7] Pallabi Dey Purkayastha of The Times of India wrote: "With a tighter, finer screenplay and more consistent performers, ‘The Power’ could have been a befitting response of this decade to the Sarkar franchise but a lacklustre narrative, among other things, brings the power down to level zero."[8] Samrudhi Ghosh of Hindustan Times wrote: "The Power, with its creative bankruptcy, brings nothing new to already done-to-death iterations of The Godfather.[9] Joginder Tuteja of Rediff.com noted, "If the film had been crisper with solid drama in the second half too, The Power could have been more powerful."[10]

Anurag Sharma from Republic World wrote "While an attempt was made by the makers to show a crime world and mafia story in a different light, they have ended up repeating the old storyline, only with unnecessary twists. Even though some of the actors made a strong effort to hold the fort from their end, it has only gone in vain."[11]

Music[]

The music for the film was composed by Salim-Sulaiman with lyrics written by Kumaar . The single "Oh Saaiyaan" was recorded by Arijit Singh and Raj Pandit.[12]
